ocaml/tools/ci/actions/check-typo.sh - ocaml

  • CheckTypoTree
  • not_pruned

Source code

  1. #!/usr/bin/env bash
  2. #**************************************************************************
  3. #*                                                                        *
  4. #*                                 OCaml                                  *
  5. #*                                                                        *
  6. #*                 David Allsopp, OCaml Labs, Cambridge.                  *
  7. #*                                                                        *

  11. #*   the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1, with the          *
  12. #*   special exception on linking described in the file LICENSE.          *
  13. #*                                                                        *
  14. #**************************************************************************

  16. # Hygiene Checks: ensure that check-typo passes for all files
  17. # This tests both branches and PRs. It is capable of requiring that every commit
  18. # in a PR satisfies check-typo, but at present it only requires that the HEAD
  19. # of the branch satisfies it.

  21. set -e

  23. # Set to 1 to require all commits individually to pass check-typo
  24. CHECK_ALL_COMMITS=0

  26. # We need all the commits in the PR to be available
  27. . tools/ci/actions/deepen-fetch.sh

  29. # Test to see if any part of the directory name has been marked prune
  30. ‌not_pruned () {
  31.   DIR=$(dirname "$1")
  32.   if [[ $DIR = '.' ]] ; then
  33.     return 0
  34.   else
  35.     case ",$(git check-attr typo.prune "$DIR" | sed -e 's/.*: //')," in
  36.       ,set,)
  37.       return 1
  38.       ;;
  39.       *)

  41.       not_pruned "$DIR"
  42.       return $?
  43.     esac
  44.   fi
  45. }

  47. # $1 - commit to checkout files from
  48. # $2 - range of commits to diff
  49. ‌CheckTypoTree () {
  50.   COMMIT="$1"
  51.   COMMITS_TO_SEARCH="$2"
  52.   export OCAML_CT_HEAD="$COMMIT"
  53.   export OCAML_CT_LS_FILES="git diff-tree --no-commit-id --name-only -r \
  54. $COMMITS_TO_SEARCH --"
  55.   export OCAML_CT_CAT='git cat-file --textconv'
  56.   export OCAML_CT_PREFIX="$COMMIT:"
  57.   GIT_INDEX_FILE=tmp-index git read-tree --reset -i "$COMMIT"
  58.   git diff-tree --diff-filter=d --no-commit-id --name-only -r \
  59.     "$COMMITS_TO_SEARCH" | (while IFS= read -r path
  60.   do
  61.     if not_pruned "$path" ; then
  62.       echo "Checking $COMMIT: $path"
  63.       if ! tools/check-typo "./$path" ; then
  64.         touch failed
  65.       fi
  66.     else
  67.       echo "NOT checking $COMMIT: $path (typo.prune)"
  68.     fi
  69.   done)
  70.   rm -f tmp-index
  71. }

  73. # tmp-index is used to ensure that correct version of .gitattributes is used by
  74. # check-typo
  75. export OCAML_CT_GIT_INDEX='tmp-index'
  76. export OCAML_CT_CA_FLAG='--cached'
  77. rm -f failed

  79. COMMIT_RANGE="$MERGE_BASE..$PR_HEAD"
  80. if ((CHECK_ALL_COMMITS)); then
  81.   # Check each commit in turn
  82.   for commit in $(git rev-list "$COMMIT_RANGE" --reverse); do
  83.     CheckTypoTree "$commit" "$commit"
  84.   done
  85. else
  86.   # Use the range of commits just to get the list of files to check; only HEAD
  87.   # is scanned.
  88.   CheckTypoTree "$FETCH_HEAD" "$COMMIT_RANGE"
  89. fi

  91. if [[ -e failed ]]; then
  92.   exit 1
  93. fi
